intro: Bunchosia guatemalensis var. guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan bunchosia, is a shrub native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in disturbed areas and along stream banks. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
